description: The type of intracellular structure formed in the root system of a plant when infected by rhizobia.
The country where a plant was collected.
The callendar day when a plant was collected.
The locality where a plant was collected, in a descriptive form.
The callendar month when a plant was collected.
The municipality where a plant was collected.
The state or province where a plant was collected.
The callendar year when a plant was collected.
The north-south position of a plant on Earth's surface.
The west-east position of a plant on Earth's surface.
The information source used to obtain the georeferenced coordinates.
The number of days elapsed since the start of an experiment.
The identification code of a flower in a given experiment. Equal codes may not represent the same flower across experiments.
The identification code of a matrix (mother plant) in a given experiment. Equal codes may not represent the same matrix across experiments.
The identification code of a plant in a given experiment. Equal codes may not represent the same plant across experiments.
The treatement applied to an observation in a given experiment. Equal names may not represent the same type of treament across experiments.
The identification code of a plant in a given fieldwork.
The number of flower buds counted on a plant.
The number of flowers oppening on a plant by day.
The linear distance between the pollen-receiving and the pollen-presenting structures within a flower. In buzz-pollinated flowers, it is the distance between the stigma and the closest anther pore.
The number of flowers counted on a plant.
The hour when a flower was visited by an animal.
Time elapsed between sucessive visits to a flower. Time zero (0) represents the first visit.
A flower-visitor phenotypic coupling index. It is calculated as the difference between the flower herkogamy and the visitor abdominal width.
The number of days elapsed until the first flowering of a plant.
The number of days elapsed until the peak flowering of a plant.
Whether a plant was flowering.
The number of fruits counted on a plant.
The number of placentations counted in a fruit.
Whether a plant formed fruits.
The collector name and collection number assigned to a plant deposited in a herbarium.
The barcode number asssigned to a plant deposited in a herbarium.
The herbarium where a plant is deposited, following the acronyms of Thiers [continously updated]
The type of information used to validate a taxonomic identification.
The callendar year when a plant was taxonomically identified.
The person who provided a taxonomic identification for a plant.
The number of leaves with active extrafloral nectaries counted on a plant.
The maximum distance measured along the main longitudinal axis of all leaves found on a plant.
The number of leaves counted on a plant.
The summed mass of leaves sampled from a plant.
The number of leaves sampled from a plant.
The number of leaf scars counted on a plant.
The total mass of all leaves from a plant.
The total number of plants devided by the number of surviving plants from a same matrix (mother plant) in a given experiment.
The number of dead plants from a same matrix (mother plant) in a given experiment.
The number of dead plants divided by the total number of plants from a same matrix (mother plant) in a given experiment.
The total number of plants deriving from a same matrix (mother plant) in a given experiment.
The number of surviving plants from a same matrix (mother plant) in a given experiment.
The number of root nodules counted on a plant.
Whether a plant had nodules in its root system.
The summed mass of root nodules sampled from a plant.
The number of root nodules sampled from a plant.
The total mass of all root nodules from a plant.
The linear distance between the ground layer and the upper boundary of the plant shoot.
The number of pollen grains counted on a flower stigma.
The number of pollen grains counted from all anthers of a visited flower.
The difference of pollen grains between unvisited and visited flowers.
The total mass of all root system from a plant.
The number of inviables seeds counted in a fruit.
The number of lost seeds counted in a fruit.
The number of viables seeds counted in a fruit.
The number of viables seeds divided by the number of placentations in a fruit.
The number of stems counted on a plant.
The total mass of all stems from a plant.
The linear distance across the widest part of the abdomen of a bee visitor.
The maximum relative peak of amplitude of vibrational pulses by a bee visitor.
The average relative peak of amplitude of vibrational pulses by a bee visitor.
The minimum relative peak of amplitude of vibrational pulses by a bee visitor.
The standard deviation of the average relative peak of amplitude during virbational pulses of a bee visitor.
The buzzing time divided by the number of vibration pulses.
The time taken by a bee visitor vibrating and extracting pollen grains from poricidal anthers.
The greatest circular movement by a bee visitor, either clockwise or counterclockwise movements, between the vibrational pulses applied to the anthers.

The sum of all circular movements by a bee visitor divided by the number of vibrational pulses applied to the anthers. The calculation disconsiders the position during the first vibrational pulse, which is set to zero.
The sum of all circular movements by a bee visitor, including clockwise and counterclockwise movements, between the vibrational pulses applied to the anthers.
The maximum frequency of vibrational pulses by a bee visitor.
The average fundamental frequency of vibrational pulses by a bee visitor.
The standard deviation of the fundamental frequency of vibrational pulses by a bee visitor.
The time taken by a bee visitor cleaning itself and transfering pollen grains to its scopa or corbicula.
The sum of the buzzing and the grooming times.
The linear distance between the inner margins of the tegulae of a bee visitor.
The number of vibrational pulses applied by a bee visitor.
The taxonomic identification of an animal visiting a flower.
The linear distance across the widest part of the thorax of a bee visitor.
Whether a visitor had touched the stigma of a flower.
